title: Is Rainie leaving EastEnders for good?
text:
Rainie’s had a difficult time lately (Picture: BBC)

Rainie Branning (Tanya Franks) has been having a troubled time in EastEnders lately.

Recent episodes of the show have seen the recovering addict struggle to wean off painkillers – with Stuart (Ricky Champ)’s attempts to help her going very wrong indeed.

And her determination to remain in baby Abi’s life hasn’t helped matters either, with the storyline set to come to a head in a way which leaves Stuart devastated.

But could this mean we’re about to bid farewell to Rainie?

Here’s what you need to know…

Is Rainie Branning leaving EastEnders for good?

As it stands there is no confirmation that Rainie is leaving Albert Square – meaning that we’ll just have to keep watching to see whether the character sticks around or does exit Walford.

However the past few weeks have been pretty challenging for the character.

Rainie’s been battling an addiction to painkillers (Picture: BBC)

She might be determined to remain in baby Abi’s life, but her drug addiction has resulted in Kathy Beale (Gillian Taylforth) and Max Branning (Jake Wood) making attempts to prevent her from doing so.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Things got even worse last week when a trial shift in the cafe didn’t go as planned, and Kathy found Rainie on the floor of her flat with a bottle of vodka in her hand.

This led to Stuart confronting Kathy and accusing her of putting Rainie’s recovery at risk by snooping – and threatened to stop her from seeing Abi if she didn’t back off.

Kathy refused to be intimidated by this though, and tried to test Rainie by putting her in the position of having to make a choice between drugs and Abi.

Tuesday night will see Stuart blackmailing Kathy, threatening to tell everyone what she did if she doesn’t agree to let Rainie see the toddler – with her later talking Kathy into letting her take her to the park.

While Stuart still has doubts about Rainie’s behaviour, Bex (Jasmine Armfield) ends up giving him some sound advice – but he’s left devastated when he later tries to track Rainie down.

What happens? You’ll have to tune in and see.

EastEnders airs Mondays and Fridays on BBC One at 8pm and on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7.30pm.

description: Rainie Branning has been having a troubled time in EastEnders but is she about to exit Albert Square?
